radiographic_examinations.findings: Left ventricular ejection fraction of 55%, left ventricular hypertrophy, severe mitral-valve regurgitation, moderate tricuspid-valve regurgitation, biatrial enlargement, mild right ventricular dilatation, and a pulmonary-artery systolic pressure of 40 to 50 mm Hg.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Marked biventricular hypertrophy, severe mitral-valve regurgitation, dilatation of inferior vena cava and hepatic vein, and a right ventricular systolic pressure of at least 31 mm Hg on third day; estimated left ventricular ejection fraction of 54% with mild thickening of the anterior leaflet of the mitral valve indicating diastolic dysfunction.
